Speaker: bierce
Dialogue: No one can deny the horrendous nature of Mr. Frankenstein's crimes, but in the twenty years he has been with us, I have never seen a patient turn his energies to more productive use.

Speaker: bierce
Dialogue: Just look at his accomplishments... three volumes of poetry, two rock operas, a sculpture garden, four romance novels... and who can forget his touching portrayal of Billy Bigelow in our all-psychotic production of "Carousel"...

Speaker: bierce
Dialogue: Directed by our own Doctor Anabel Leek.

Speaker: casanova
Dialogue: Twenty years ago I was a lost soul. Loveless...  I'm sorry!  I'm SO SO SORRY!

Speaker: casanova
Dialogue: And don't be afraid of the dark...

Speaker: casanova
Dialogue: Those gas leaks can be murder.

Speaker: big red
Dialogue: And what if he rats on us?

Speaker: big red
Dialogue: Stick a brick in his Pampers and dump him in the lake.

Speaker: raja
Dialogue: Not so fast, gentlemen--and I use the term loosely... Unhand that youngster...

Speaker: big red
Dialogue: What are you guys supposed to be... superheroes?

Speaker: big red
Dialogue: Really?  Did you mother make those costumes?

Speaker: big red
Dialogue: This is our territory.  Beat it.

Speaker: raja
Dialogue: And there's plenty more where that came from.

Speaker: red eyes
Dialogue: Crush him, Mikey!... Mash him!... Mush him!

Speaker: red eyes
Dialogue: He wants more!... Squish him!... Finish him off!

Speaker: red eyes
Dialogue: We give!... We're sorry!... We had terrible childhoods!

Speaker: dawn
Dialogue: Looks like you've done it again, Captain.

Speaker: cop 1
Dialogue: Okay, show's over. Move it. On your way.

Speaker: raja
Dialogue: Wait a minute, Officers. You don't understand-- we're superheroes, and we just busted up this gang.

Speaker: cop 1
Dialogue: Really?  Let me guess-you're Towel Head and he's...  Captain Pooper Scooper!

Speaker: cop 1
Dialogue: And leave crime fighting to the real thing!

Speaker: raja
Dialogue: He doesn't miss a trick, does he?

Speaker: furious
Dialogue: What a jerk--and like nobody knows who he really is!

Speaker: furious
Dialogue: He's Lance Hunt!  Just take off the glasses-- and it's him!

Speaker: furious
Dialogue: A vague similarity?  IT'S THE SAME GUY!

Speaker: shoveler
Dialogue: 0h, who gives a damn who he is? I can't take this anymore.  Night after night we're on the streets, busting our humps--and for what?

Speaker: raja
Dialogue: We take the licks and he gets the chicks.

Speaker: shoveler
Dialogue: How long do you have to chase a dream before you realize it's not gonna happen?

Speaker: furious
Dialogue: We need a break, that's all! Nobody'd ever heard of him until he busted Casanova Frankenstein!

Speaker: raja
Dialogue: But look at him... and look at us.

Speaker: raja
Dialogue: I lost another fork tonight.  She's getting suspicious, I know it.

Speaker: furious
Dialogue: So why don't you just tell her!

Speaker: raja
Dialogue: Because I can't!  Okay?  She wouldn't understand!

Speaker: shoveler
Dialogue: Leave him alone.  She's his mother, not yours.

Speaker: furious
Dialogue: We had an off night, that's all.

Speaker: shoveler
Dialogue: So when are we gonna have an on night?

Speaker: waitress
Dialogue: It's my first night.  My name's Monica.

Speaker: monica
Dialogue: You guys going to a costume party?

Speaker: raja
Dialogue: We prefer to think of ourselves as unsung... I am the Blue Raja, Master of Silverware...

Speaker: raja
Dialogue: And these are my associatiates, the Shoveler.

Speaker: raja
Dialogue: And Mister Furious... His anger is his power.

Speaker: raja
Dialogue: Usually a superpower is a magical endowment or a great skill.  In his case, it's entirely emotional.

Speaker: monica
Dialogue: So what can I get you?

Speaker: raja
Dialogue: Burgers all around.  Rare. (meaning Furious} Raw.

Speaker: raja
Dialogue: Roy, when was the last time you had an actual date?

Speaker: furious
Dialogue: Doesn't it piss you off the way the when you really want to talk to somebody you can't think of anything to say!

Speaker: monica
Dialogue: I guess... Are you always so angry?

Speaker: furious
Dialogue: Only when I'm awake... You busy after work?

Speaker: furious
Dialogue: Want to go out and get drunk?

Speaker: raja
Dialogue: Maybe you should try a more romantic approach.

Speaker: furious
Dialogue: Like what?  Cutting off my own ear?

Speaker: shoveler
Dialogue: Hey, when are you guys gonna clean this place up?

Speaker: mother
Dialogue: What are you doing in the silver drawer?

Speaker: raja
Dialogue: Of course.  I'm such a fool... Thanks, Mummy. Go to bed.

Speaker: furious
Dialogue: Amazing?  What's so amazing about him?  I'd be amazing, too, if I'd inherited two hundred million bucks... or two bucks... or two cents...  Who am I kidding?  Dreams don't come true.

Speaker: casanova
Dialogue: I hope you enjoy these cigars.  I had to kill a dozen Cubans to get them.

Speaker: casanova
Dialogue: I knew you'd cone.  I left that skylight open for you.

Speaker: amazing
Dialogue: I know you knew I'd know.

Speaker: casanova
Dialogue: But did you know I knew you'd know I'd know?

Speaker: amazing
Dialogue: I'd hate to waste a good bullet on a piece of scum like you, Tony.

Speaker: amazing
Dialogue: The jig is up, Casanova.  I've spent six months watching you, and know exactly what you're up to.

Speaker: amazing
Dialogue: I know that you're recruiting your old henchmen...

Speaker: amazing
Dialogue: I know who your girlfriend really is...

Speaker: amazing
Dialogue: And I know the terrible revenge that you plan to inflict on this city.

Speaker: casanova
Dialogue: I guess you know just about everything, don't you, Lance?

Speaker: casanova
Dialogue: That I've hot wired the city's entire power supply through that catwalk.

Speaker: boss
Dialogue: YO! CAPTAIN SOMINEX!  Get your shut-eye at home, or you'll be a full time superhero!

Speaker: anthony
Dialogue: It's all within your power.  The only thing that's in your way is YOU!

Speaker: sally
Dialogue: How many times I gotta tell you about this?

Speaker: furious
Dialogue: Sally, that's a Herkimer Battle Jitney!  They don't make 'em like that anymore.  It's a classic!

Speaker: sally
Dialogue: It's a hunk of junk.  I want the iron.  Do it!

Speaker: radio announcer
Dialogue: ...and continues to deny any knowledge of the incident... In local news, millionaire Lance Hunt has apparently disappeared...

Speaker: radio announcer
Dialogue: Members at his household told police that the playboy philanthropist failed to return home last night after "going out for a walk". Police say they have no reason yet to suspect foul play, but a search is under way...

Speaker: furious
Dialogue: I saw him go in--and he didn't come out!

Speaker: raja
Dialogue: But we don't know for sure it's the same guy.

Speaker: casanova
Dialogue: Well, Don, I've done some terrible things in my life, but now I'm cured, and I just want to give back something to my old home town... That's why I'm using what's left of my fortune to build...

Speaker: raja
Dialogue: The most vicious gang of thugs this city ever produced.  Twenty years ago they were Casanova's personal bodyguard.  But after he was busted they crawled into the woodwork.

Speaker: shoveler
Dialogue: We may be getting in over our heads here.

Speaker: raja
Dialogue: This looks like a job for Superman--

Speaker: furious
Dialogue: Don't you guys get it?  If Captain Amazing is still in there, we can rescue him--and get on TV!

Speaker: casanova
Dialogue: Everything's going exactly as we planned.

Speaker: anabel
Dialogue: Not quite.  You haven't announced our engagement yet.

Speaker: casanova
Dialogue: It must have slipped my mind.

Speaker: casanova
Dialogue: Don't worry, Pootchkie.  My womanizing days are over.  You're my Lady Macbeth, my Imelda... my Nicole.

Speaker: raja
Dialogue: Oh I'm sorry.  We must have the wrong house.

Speaker: monica
Dialogue: Maybe you guys ought to forget this Superhero stuff and join Kiwanis or something.

Speaker: furious
Dialogue: Are you serious? This is the break we've been waiting for!

Speaker: furious
Dialogue: What have the famous superheroes got that we don't?

Speaker: furious
Dialogue: Archenemies!  Casanova isn't just a criminal-- he's a supervillain. Stopping him could be our ticket to fame, fortune--and babes!

Speaker: shoveler
Dialogue: And it would be the right thing to do.

Speaker: raja
Dialogue: But there's only three of us, and he's got the entire brotherhood of evil at his disposal.

Speaker: furious
Dialogue: Then maybe it's time for us to form our own brotherhood...

Speaker: furious
Dialogue: I say we send out the word--and summon all of the unsung superheroes we know!

Speaker: raja
Dialogue: Yeah, but... who do we know?

Speaker: shoveler
Dialogue: I got this cousin.  He's a real doofus, but he claims he can become invisible.

Speaker: shoveler
Dialogue: How could I see him if he's invisible?

Speaker: raja
Dialogue: He's a legendary masked Mexican crime fighting superwrestler and master of the machete.

Speaker: raja
Dialogue: No one's sure that he actually exists, but they say he can be contacted by leaving a message on a crumpled up napkin at the Tacky Taco down by the bus station.

Speaker: furious
Dialogue: You sure that's how you spell it?

Speaker: furious
Dialogue: So, let me get this straight.  You have the power to become invisible.

Speaker: raja
Dialogue: But... only when no one is looking.

Speaker: furious
Dialogue: If someone looks at you, you immediately become visible again.

Speaker: raja
Dialogue: So you're only invisible... to yourself?

Speaker: invisible boy
Dialogue: If I look at myseif, I become visible.

Speaker: raja
Dialogue: So you're only invisible, when abuolutely no one is looking at you?

Speaker: furious
Dialogue: So how do you know that you've ever been invisible?

Speaker: furious
Dialogue: Look, kid, we've got a lot of heroes to interview--

Speaker: invisible boy
Dialogue: I know I haven't got it entirely worked out yet, but I've always dreamed of becoming a superhero... Weren't you guys ever a kid? Didn't you ever need someone to just give you a chance?

Speaker: spleen
Dialogue: Boy I can't tell you how thrilled I was when you guys called--You gonna eat that pickle?  I've always dreamed of being a member of the a real superhero team--and to have friends--real friends--I mean guys I could live with--sleep with--die with--eat with...

Speaker: invisible boy
Dialogue: So what exactly is your superpower?

Speaker: spleen
Dialogue: Well, when I was a kid I grew up on Love Canal- -remember that?--and my brothers and I used to go swimming in it--make Kool-Aid out of it-- stuff like that.  Anyway my brothers all died, but I lived, and I grew all these like weird organs that have never been seen in humans before.  So now I can do things like this!

Speaker: shoveler
Dialogue: Hey, why don't you just put a cork in it?

Speaker: spleen
Dialogue: I tried that once.  The cork melted.

Speaker: shoveler
Dialogue: There's just not enough of us.

Speaker: furious
Dialogue: But we know they're out there. Hundreds--maybe thousands of lonely, unknown superheroes, who desperately need a cause...

Speaker: shoveler
Dialogue: Yeah, but how do we get to them?

Speaker: monica
Dialogue: Why don't you throw a barbecue?

Speaker: spleen
Dialogue: Come on in!  The water's great!

Speaker: spleen
Dialogue: Hey, these pool mints are delicious!

Speaker: furious
Dialogue: Who are we kidding?  No one's gonna show. We're living in a fantasy!

Speaker: invisible boy
Dialogue: Come on, guys--we're fighting against evil.

Speaker: furious
Dialogue: Good or evil, what's the difference?

Speaker: furious
Dialogue: I used to believe that.  Now I'm not so sure.

Speaker: raja
Dialogue: Roy, remember, it is all within your power. The only thing that's in your way... is you.

Speaker: their leader
Dialogue: Hey, man, is this the superhero wingding?

Speaker: raja
Dialogue: This is it.  Come on in!

Speaker: raja
Dialogue: I am the Blue Raja, Master of Silverware.

Speaker: their leader
Dialogue: I am Squeegee Man, and these are my compadres, the Invincible Dudes!

Speaker: raja
Dialogue: Would you mind filling out these forms; names, addresses, description of superpowers, that sort of thing.

Speaker: raja
Dialogue: Actually we lied about the babes, but there's plenty of burgers.

Speaker: invincible dudes
Dialogue: That's false advertising!... We came all the way from South Champion, man!  We coulda gone plinking!... We coulda gone bunqee jumping!

Speaker: furious
Dialogue: If you're a superhero, what's your power?

Speaker: squeegee man
Dialogue: I am Squeegee Man.  Touch my squeegee... and you die.

Speaker: invincible dudes
Dialogue: Let's get out of here!... That dude's crazy!

Speaker: shoveler
Dialogue: The Bowler?  I remember him from when I was a kid.  He was killed years ago.

Speaker: shoveler
Dialogue: Look, honey, being a superhero... it's a guy thing.

Speaker: bowler
Dialogue: If it could zip up its own bag, then you'd be impressed, right?

Speaker: furious
Dialogue: Hey... Can I buy you a beer?

Speaker: bowler
Dialogue: And then one day, he didn't come home.  The police said it was an accident.  But cargo containers don't just fall on people.  He was murdered... After that I fell apart.  I dropped out of school, became a mud wrestler, married and divorced a jerk.  When my mother died I hit bottom... but then, when I was cleaning out her attic, I found my father's old bowling bag and costume, almost like he'd left them there for me... and I knew what I had to do.

Speaker: furious
Dialogue: You know something? Those guys are really starting TO PISS ME OFF!

Speaker: shoveler
Dialogue: But there's still only six of us.

Speaker: bowler
Dialogue: That's two more than the Fantastic Four.

Speaker: invisible boy
Dialogue: And only one short of the Magnificent Seven.

Speaker: raja
Dialogue: And you can't count Horst Buckholtz anyway.

Speaker: raja
Dialogue: But they all had one thing we haven't got.

Speaker: raja
Dialogue: A name.  All the great superhero teams have got a fabulous name.

Speaker: spleen
Dialogue: Wait--I got it!... The Spleen Team.

Speaker: furious
Dialogue: To hell with a name.  Let's get to work.

Speaker: furious
Dialogue: What did you do with Captain Amazing?

Speaker: bowler
Dialogue: But she's your mother.  You gotta tell her.

Speaker: invisible boy
Dialogue: Dad thinks all this superhero stuff is a stupid waste of time.

Speaker: raja
Dialogue: I'm her only son, and she always had such high hopes for me. Medicine.  Law.

Speaker: raja
Dialogue: The cape.  The turban.  She wouldn't understand.

Speaker: bowler
Dialogue: I know... My girlfriends all dumped me after I put on the mask.  They thought I'd lost it.

Speaker: raja
Dialogue: But in fact... you'd found it.

Speaker: shoveler
Dialogue: This is your dream... and you can't ever give it up.

Speaker: invisible boy
Dialogue: I wonder what he dreams about?

Speaker: bowler
Dialogue: Come on, Junior, it's a school night.

Speaker: furious
Dialogue: Anybody up for a little White Castle?

Speaker: sphinx
Dialogue: You call yourselves superheroes? A rooster fights more intelligently than you!  You have shown yourself to your enemy and revealed your powers to him--and what have you accouplished for this?  You have destroyed his car. Brilliant!  If you want to survive you must fight like a wolf pack--not like a six pack!

Speaker: sphinx
Dialogue: The wolf is cunning.  He knows that stealth is his greatest weapon, and he always fights as a team...

Speaker: sphinx
Dialogue: Casanova Frankenstein is a a master of evil. You will need more than shovels and dessert forks to stop him... What else have you got?

Speaker: furious
Dialogue: So what else has Superman got?

Speaker: shoveler
Dialogue: He's got the fact that he's Superman!

Speaker: shoveler
Dialogue: We didn't think this through very well.

Speaker: bowler
Dialogue: My father had this friend... He was an inventor...

Speaker: shoveler
Dialogue: Are you sure he's still lives here?

Speaker: raja
Dialogue: Are you sure he's still alive?

Speaker: bowler
Dialogue: He was the last time I saw him.

Speaker: heller
Dialogue: Elizabeth!  Little Elizabeth!  Why you're so... middle aged!

Speaker: heller
Dialogue: Oh that's right--they squished him...  Heck of a guy.

Speaker: bowler
Dialogue: Doc, these are my friends.  We're superheroes, and we need your help.

Speaker: heller
Dialogue: Well, I give to the United Way, and I feel that sort of covers--

Speaker: heller
Dialogue: My weapons? You need my weapons?

Speaker: heller
Dialogue: The military establishment has never understood me.  They won't return my phone calls, much less field test anything.  But I knew that someday I'd get my chance, and now... here you are!

Speaker: raja
Dialogue: But, Doc... where's the machine guns?

Speaker: heller
Dialogue: You don't need that junk!  You see, for thousands of years mankind has been immolating, disemboweling, and exploding itself.  Why? Because we have this built-in screwed up need to go to war!

Speaker: heller
Dialogue: Now here's a beauty!  I call it the Shrinker!  I developed it after years of studying the worst dry cleaners I could find.  It instantly shrinks fabrics to half their size.  Anyone caught in its spray is immediately immobilized by their own clothing!

Speaker: furious
Dialogue: Okay! We got the firepower!  I say we throw it into the car, drive over to Casanova's house, and kick some ass!

Speaker: sphinx
Dialogue: We are not yet ready.  Now we must learn to fight together... as one thing.

Speaker: raja
Dialogue: Twenty years ago all the major hoodlums of this city were united into one great brotherhood of evil, and Casanova was their king.

Speaker: shoveler
Dialogue: Crime was rampant.  It wasn't safe to stay in your home.

Speaker: raja
Dialogue: He busted Casanova and sent the crooks packing.

Speaker: shoveler
Dialogue: And this has been a pretty nice place to live ever since.

Speaker: furious
Dialogue: But now Casanova's back!  And we're gonna sit around here all night eating pizza and telling stories! Hey, lets toast some marshmellows!

Speaker: sphinx
Dialogue: The wise snake coils before he strikes.

Speaker: furious
Dialogue: When are you going to take off that mask?

Speaker: sphinx
Dialogue: When I am sure I am among friends.

Speaker: furious
Dialogue: Go dance with your mother, Jeffrey!

Speaker: sphinx
Dialogue: Your rage is a very great power, but it blinds you to your heart.

Speaker: furious
Dialogue: My heart died a long time ago.

Speaker: sphinx
Dialogue: It is not dead.  It is hiding.

Speaker: furious
Dialogue: Blow it out your bean hole, Pancho!... And to hell with the rest of you!... Look at you. Bunch of rejects.  I didn't need you before-- and I don't need you now!

Speaker: bowler
Dialogue: Has he always been like this?

Speaker: mother
Dialogue: Now honey, you just wait in the car.  Mommy and Daddy will be right beck.

Speaker: mother
Dialogue: It's nice and cool in here.

Speaker: father
Dialogue: Barkeep, a couple of cold ones.

Speaker: bartender
Dialogue: And here's a banana for your monkey.

Speaker: mother
Dialogue: Oh my God!  Oh my God!  Oh my God!

Speaker: dawn
Dialogue: ...still no sign of millionaire Lance Hunt, and now, in an unrelated story, another one of Champion City's leading citizens has apparently disappeared. Captain Amazing has not been seen or heard from in a week. Authorities believe that the hard working superhero may just be taking a well deserved rest.

Speaker: furious
Dialogue: Monica... I was wondering if--uh-maybe we--I mean you and I--could-uh--you know--get a--I mean have a...

Speaker: monica
Dialogue: I get off work in fifteen minutes. Walk me home?

Speaker: monica
Dialogue: Being a superhero, wanting to save the world. It's so... unselfish.

Speaker: monica
Dialogue: Most people just want to make money or be famous or something.  But you risk everything, just to help people.

Speaker: monica
Dialogue: I've never been able to figure out what to do with my life, which is why I guess I'm still a waitress.

Speaker: furious
Dialogue: Nothing wrong with being a waitress.

Speaker: monica
Dialogue: Me too... I love this stupid old town.  It's noisy.  It's smelly. It's falling apart.

Speaker: monica
Dialogue: I've thought of leaving, going to Chicago or New York, but...

Speaker: furious
Dialogue: What have they got that we ain't got?

Speaker: monica
Dialogue: Champion's going to bounce back, and I want to be here when it does.

Speaker: monica
Dialogue: You don't seem very angry right now.

Speaker: monica
Dialogue: You know what?  Underneath all that anger I think there's just a little boy who wants everyone to love him.

Speaker: furious
Dialogue: I just want to be a superhero.

Speaker: casanova
Dialogue: Take it easy--take it easy.  I just want to have a little chat... That was quite a number you did on my car.  You've got a lot of violence in you... and I like that in a guy.

Speaker: casanova
Dialogue: You know what the difference is between good and evil, Roy?

Speaker: casanova
Dialogue: Evil is more fun.  When you want something, you just take it, and if somebody gets in your way, you kill them... You seem like a very frustrated guy, Roy.  Unhappy. Unfulfilled. What is it that you've always wanted, always desired?  Because whatever it is, I can give it to you... Fame?  The easiest of all.

Speaker: casanova
Dialogue: I'll let you in on a little secret, Roy.  In two days this entire city will belong to me, and there's not a damn thing your little pals can do about it.  It's the perfect time to switch teams... So what do you say?

Speaker: casanova
Dialogue: They always call the great ones nuts.

Speaker: furious
Dialogue: And the nuts always call themselves great.

Speaker: casanova
Dialogue: Are you with me... or against me?

Speaker: furious
Dialogue: Thanks for reminding me which team I'm on.

Speaker: guard 2
Dialogue: What are you two doing here?

Speaker: guard 1
Dialogue: Not talking, eh?  That can be fixed.  Turn around, start walking up the hill--

Speaker: invisible boy
Dialogue: Whatever was in that crate... is from Russia.

Speaker: furious
Dialogue: I was wrong... I need my friends.

Speaker: furious
Dialogue: Casanova said that in two days the entire city would belong to him... and there wasn't a thing that we could do about it.

Speaker: shoveler
Dialogue: Maybe it's time we checked that place out.

Speaker: raja
Dialogue: But how do we get in?

Speaker: furious
Dialogue: We just become like the wolf... who wears the sheep's clothing.

Speaker: shoveler
Dialogue: This place is built like a fortress.

Speaker: raja
Dialogue: Oh my God... Every crook in the city is here.

Speaker: casanova
Dialogue: Monica... Beautiful name.  It suits you.

Speaker: casanova
Dialogue: I hope you won't take this the wrong way, but I couldn't help but notice... that you're a dead ringer for Veronica Lake in "The Blue Dahlia".

Speaker: casanova
Dialogue: You know I'm writing a play--it's just a little Broadway thing, but thure's a part in it that I think you'd be perfect for.

Speaker: casanova
Dialogue: I'd love to hear you read it. Could you stick around after the luncheon?

Speaker: casanova
Dialogue: What are you three doing here? This is invited guests only.  Out.

Speaker: shoveler
Dialogue: But we gotta find out what's going on in there.

Speaker: monica
Dialogue: What are you guys doing here?

Speaker: casanova
Dialogue: Thank you all for coming.  I hope you enjoy the cigars.  I had to kill a dozen Cubans to get them.

Speaker: casanova
Dialogue: Twenty years ago, this town was yours!  AND I WAS YOUR KING!

Speaker: casanova
Dialogue: But they called me a psycho, and they put me away.  For twenty years I rotted in my cell, painting watercolors, writing haikus--just waiting for the day I could take my revenge. Well, brothers, that day has come!

Speaker: casanova
Dialogue: They thought I was crazy? Well the joke's on them--because tonight at precisely midnight--on the twentieth anniversary of my tragic arrest-- every man, woman, and child in this city is going to turn into a RAVING PSYCSOTIC!  Mothers will murder their tots!  Old ladies will strangle their cats!  Children will bump off their babysitters!

Speaker: italian ice
Dialogue: Nobody could drive a whole city crazy.

Speaker: casanova
Dialogue: Tell you what, Ice.  I'll mke you a friendly little wager.  It I can't do it... you can blow my brains out.  If I can, I'll blow out yours.

Speaker: casanova
Dialogue: Honey, give the boys a taste.

Speaker: crooks
Dialogue: That was great!... What the hell was that?... How did you do that?

Speaker: casanova
Dialogue: Tonight, at midnight, that sound will be amplified across this entire city.  Murder and mayhem will reign supreme!  And Champion City will be ours again!  This will be our castle! And I will be our king!  And there's no one to stop us!

Speaker: casanova
Dialogue: Don't worry, fellas...  I killed him... and I've had him stuffed.

Speaker: amazing
Dialogue: Oh, my abs are killing me!

Speaker: monica
Dialogue: What could have made such a horrible noise?

Speaker: heller
Dialogue: Ten years ago the Kremlin's top secret Psychiatric Warfare Division developed a prototype for a weapon that emitted a fluctuating alternative frequency noise that produced a violent psychotic reaction in any mammal within hearing distance.  But when the old Soviet Union fell the stridulator and its brilliant inventor, Doctor Kopov, disappeared.

Speaker: shoveler
Dialogue: This Kopov, what happened to him?

Speaker: heller
Dialogue: A village in Siberia was wiped out when a cleaning woman switched it on by mistake.

Speaker: monica
Dialogue: We've got to warn the city.

Speaker: bowler
Dialogue: They'll think we're just a bunch of weirdoes.

Speaker: furious
Dialogue: We know what we gotta do.

Speaker: furious
Dialogue: Maybe.  But this isn't about living or dying. It's about good versus evil, and we're good, whether we like it or not... Maybe we look a little funny...

Speaker: furious
Dialogue: And smell a little funny.  We're not bulletproof and we can't fly. But we're superheroes--and that means doing what's right- -even when it's impossible... This is our city- -these are our friends, our famlies--and if we don't save them, nobody will!  So I say we take a ride up that hill, blast our way in there, destroy that Psycho-whatchamabob-- and teach those deviants a lesson they'll never forget!

Speaker: shoveler
Dialogue: And we'll take a bunch of 'em with us!

Speaker: monica
Dialogue: I just want you guys to know--I may not be a superhero, but I'm with you--and I want to help!

Speaker: bowler
Dialogue: We could really use some coffee--

Speaker: raja
Dialogue: But that place is huge and we don't know where this psycho thing is--

Speaker: bowler
Dialogue: Or even what it looks like.

Speaker: heller
Dialogue: And he must have it well hidden.

Speaker: furious
Dialogue: We'll just have to get lucky.

Speaker: furious
Dialogue: Go do what you gotta do.  We'll meet back here at sunset... Do or die.

Speaker: shoveler
Dialogue: Baby, if I don't make it... find yourself... a normal guy.

Speaker: lucille
Dialogue: I don't want a normal guy.

Speaker: raja
Dialogue: Mother... it's not what you think!

Speaker: mother
Dialogue: And why are you wearing that silly costume?

Speaker: raja
Dialogue: Oh, Mother, I'm sorry.  I know how much you wanted me to be a doctor or a lawyer with a family--but it's just not who I am!

Speaker: raja
Dialogue: I use it... to fight evil.

Speaker: mother
Dialogue: I always knew that you were special.

Speaker: mother
Dialogue: Ever since you were a little boy...  Come with me.

Speaker: mother
Dialogue: Your Great Great Grandmother's wedding silver.

Speaker: furious
Dialogue: Come on, baby... Come on, baby... I SAID COME ON!

Speaker: furious
Dialogue: Are you nuts?  Get out of there!

Speaker: monica
Dialogue: Listen, Casanova may be a supervillain, but he's got a weakness, and I'm it.  Maybe--just maybe--I can trick him into showing me the location of the whatchamathing.

Speaker: furious
Dialogue: He's a psycho!  He'll kill you!

Speaker: monica
Dialogue: Just shut up and listen.  Hold off the attack as long as you can.  If I can discover the location I'll call you--

Speaker: furious
Dialogue: And what if you get killed?

Speaker: monica
Dialogue: Then at least I will have died trying, right?

Speaker: monica
Dialogue: Roy... We might never see each other again, so I'd better tell you now...  I think you're wonderful.

Speaker: monica
Dialogue: Could you tell Mr. Frankenstein that Monica is here?

Speaker: casanova
Dialogue: I thought you'd chickened out on me.

Speaker: monica
Dialogue: Just wanted to... powder my nose.

Speaker: furious
Dialogue: Listen.  He's lonely... and he doesn't care who knows it.

Speaker: furious
Dialogue: We're all the same really.  Our songs, our dreams, our seeds are all just a brave attempt to live forever.

Speaker: sphinx
Dialogue: He is in love.  His anger is gone.

Speaker: casanova
Dialogue: This is where I come to... be alone.

Speaker: furious
Dialogue: But I just don't feel it.

Speaker: raja
Dialogue: He's turned into a completely normal person!

Speaker: furious
Dialogue: Normal.  What's normal?  Does normal exist? And if it did, how would we know it?

Speaker: furious
Dialogue: You know, Eddie, that was really uncalled for.

Speaker: furious
Dialogue: Okay, you win.  I'm pissed off. I'm seriously peeved.

Speaker: monica
Dialogue: I'm not that kind of girl.

Speaker: anabel
Dialogue: What are you doing all alone in the dark?

Speaker: raja
Dialogue: If this doesn't do it, nothing will!

Speaker: furious
Dialogue: This music is just SO BEAUTIFUL!

Speaker: raja
Dialogue: With or without him, we gotta go!

Speaker: casanova
Dialogue: I'll be down in a jiffy.

Speaker: casanova
Dialogue: I saw him walk you home.

Speaker: casanova
Dialogue: Don't be afraid... I never hit a lady...

Speaker: raja
Dialogue: May the forks be with us!

Speaker: drunk
Dialogue: A Herkimer?  Those yuppies will drive anything.

Speaker: casanova
Dialogue: Fellas, this is woman without whom I would have gone sane.

Speaker: raja
Dialogue: Not bad for a normal guy!

Speaker: heller
Dialogue: Laser eye... and it's a humdinger.

Speaker: shoveler
Dialogue: Doc, there's got to be a way.

Speaker: monica's voice
Dialogue: It's up here!  It's up here!

Speaker: casanova
Dialogue: Thanks, Roy!  She's just my type. You can have her back... when I'm done!

Speaker: casanova
Dialogue: Some girls just know how to die.

Speaker: casanova
Dialogue: Darling, you've got the wrong idea.

Speaker: casanova
Dialogue: I was only strangling her... I've killed hundreds of women. It doesn't mean a thing.  Pootchkie, you're over-reacting. This is our night.  It's what we've lied for... cheated for... murdered for.  She's just a plaything, a trifle... You're the only woman who's ever meant anything to me. I adore you.  I worship you.  I want to make you my bride.

Speaker: casanova
Dialogue: There's just one thing...  I don't need you anymore.

Speaker: casanova
Dialogue: Don't worry, Darling.  I never hit a lady.

Speaker: invisible boy
Dialogue: Guys, I did it! I did it!  I'm invisible!

Speaker: shoveler
Dialogue: This is it!  DO OR DIE!

Speaker: casanova
Dialogue: Roy... What took you so long?

Speaker: casanova
Dialogue: Let me guess... Bullets don't hurt you.

Speaker: furious
Dialogue: They hurt... BUT THEY DON'T STOP ME!

Speaker: casanova
Dialogue: Smarts, doesn't it?... Shall we dance?

Speaker: disco boys
Dialogue: Help!... Get me out of this!

Speaker: casanova
Dialogue: Roy, you're making this too easy.

Speaker: kids
Dialogue: Dad!... Dad!... You okay?... You hurt?

Speaker: roland
Dialogue: You really are a superhero, aren't you?

Speaker: shoveler
Dialogue: And that's when the engine blew up.

Speaker: doc heller
Dialogue: So you're never actually conscious of range or trajectory?

Speaker: dawn
Dialogue: It's been twenty-four hours since the deadly psycho-sonic attack and bloody shoot-out that left Casanova Frankenstein and dozen of the city's top hoodlums dead... But tonight the question remains... Who were these heroic mystery men who saved our city?...

Speaker: raja
Dialogue: Wait a minute... That's it.  That's our name. We're... the Mystery Men.

Speaker: bowler
Dialogue: Hey, do I look like a Man?

Speaker: shoveler
Dialogue: Well we can't call ourselves the Mystery People.

Speaker: spleen
Dialogue: Mystery, Mystery Man... I want to be a Mystery Man...

Speaker: furious
Dialogue: It doesn't matter what we call ourselves.  We know who we are.
